member.name: T:System.Linq.EnumerableEx
member.summary: Provides a set of additional static methods that allow querying enumerable sequences.

member.name: M:System.Linq.EnumerableEx.While``1(System.Func{System.Boolean},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0})
member.summary: Generates an enumerable sequence by repeating a source sequence as long as the given loop condition holds.
member.param: Sequence to repeat while the condition evaluates true.
member.returns: Sequence generated by repeating the given sequence while the condition evaluates to true.

member.name: M:System.Linq.EnumerableEx.If``1(System.Func{System.Boolean},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0})
member.summary: Returns an enumerable sequence based on the evaluation result of the given condition.
member.param: Sequence to return in case the condition evaluates true.
Sequence to return in case the condition evaluates false.
member.returns: Either of the two input sequences based on the result of evaluating the condition.

member.name: M:System.Linq.EnumerableEx.If``1(System.Func{System.Boolean},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0})
member.summary: Returns an enumerable sequence if the evaluation result of the given condition is true, otherwise returns an empty sequence.
member.param: Sequence to return in case the condition evaluates true.
member.returns: The given input sequence if the condition evaluates true; otherwise, an empty sequence.

member.name: M:System.Linq.EnumerableEx.DoWhile``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Func{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Generates an enumerable sequence by repeating a source sequence as long as the given loop postcondition holds.
member.param: Source sequence to repeat while the condition evaluates true.
member.returns: Sequence generated by repeating the given sequence until the condition evaluates to false.

member.name: M:System.Linq.EnumerableEx.Case``2(System.Func{``0},System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{``0,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``1}})
member.summary: Returns a sequence from a dictionary based on the result of evaluating a selector function.
member.param: Selector function used to pick a sequence from the given sources.
Dictionary mapping selector values onto resulting sequences.
member.returns: The source sequence corresponding with the evaluated selector value; otherwise, an empty sequence.

member.name: M:System.Linq.EnumerableEx.Case``2(System.Func{``0},System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{``0,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``1}},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``1})
member.summary: Returns a sequence from a dictionary based on the result of evaluating a selector function, also specifying a default sequence.
member.param: Selector function used to pick a sequence from the given sources.
Dictionary mapping selector values onto resulting sequences.
Default sequence to return in case there's no corresponding source for the computed selector value.
member.returns: The source sequence corresponding with the evaluated selector value; otherwise, the default source.

member.summary: Generates a sequence by enumerating a source sequence, mapping its elements on result sequences, and concatenating those sequences.

member.returns: Sequence concatenating the inner sequences that result from evaluating the result selector on elements from the source.

member.summary: Concatenates the input sequences.
member.returns: Sequence with the elements of the source sequences concatenated.

member.name: M:System.Linq.EnumerableEx.Concat``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0}[])
member.summary: Concatenates the input sequences.
member.returns: Sequence with the elements of the source sequences concatenated.

member.name: M:System.Linq.EnumerableEx.SelectMany``2(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``1})
member.summary: Projects each element of a sequence to an given sequence and flattens the resulting sequences into one sequence.
member.param: A sequence of values to project.
Inner sequence each source sequenec element is projected onto.
member.returns: Sequence flattening the sequences that result from projecting elements in the source sequence.

member.name: M:System.Linq.EnumerableEx.Hide``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0})
member.summary: Hides the enumerable sequence object identity.
member.returns: Enumerable sequence with the same behavior as the original, but hiding the source object identity.
member.remarks: AsEnumerable doesn't hide the object identity, and simply acts as a cast to the IEnumerable<TSource> interface.

member.name: M:System.Linq.EnumerableEx.Catch``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0}})
member.summary: Creates a sequence by concatenating source sequences until a source sequence completes successfully.

member.name: M:System.Linq.EnumerableEx.Catch``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0}[])
member.summary: Creates a sequence by concatenating source sequences until a source sequence completes successfully.

member.name: M:System.Linq.EnumerableEx.Catch``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0})
member.summary: Creates a sequence that returns the elements of the first sequence, switching to the second in case of an error.
member.param: Second sequence, concatenated to the result in case the first sequence completes exceptionally.
member.returns: The first sequence, followed by the second sequence in case an error is produced.

member.name: M:System.Linq.EnumerableEx.Finally``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Action)

member.param: Action to run upon termination of the sequence, or when an enumerator is disposed.
member.returns: Source sequence with guarantees on the invocation of the finally action.

member.summary: Creates a sequence that concatenates the given sequences, regardless of whether an error occurs in any of the sequences.
member.returns: Sequence concatenating the elements of the given sequences, ignoring errors.

member.name: M:System.Linq.EnumerableEx.Share``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0})
member.summary: Creates a buffer with a shared view over the source sequence, causing each enumerator to fetch the next element from the source sequence.
member.returns: Buffer enabling each enumerator to retrieve elements from the shared source sequence.

member.name: M:System.Linq.EnumerableEx.Share``2(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Func{System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``1}})
member.summary: Shares the source sequence within a selector function where each enumerator can fetch the next element from the source sequence.
member.param: Selector function with shared access to the source sequence for each enumerator.
member.returns: Sequence resulting from applying the selector function to the shared view over the source sequence.

member.name: M:System.Linq.EnumerableEx.Publish``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0})
member.summary: Creates a buffer with a view over the source sequence, causing each enumerator to obtain access to the remainder of the sequence from the current index in the buffer.
member.returns: Buffer enabling each enumerator to retrieve elements from the shared source sequence, starting from the index at the point of obtaining the enumerator.

member.name: M:System.Linq.EnumerableEx.Publish``2(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Func{System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``1}})
member.summary: Publishes the source sequence within a selector function where each enumerator can obtain a view over a tail of the source sequence.
member.param: Selector function with published access to the source sequence for each enumerator.
member.returns: Sequence resulting from applying the selector function to the published view over the source sequence.

member.name: M:System.Linq.EnumerableEx.Memoize``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0})
member.summary: Creates a buffer with a view over the source sequence, causing each enumerator to obtain access to all of the sequence's elements without causing multiple enumerations over the source.
member.returns: Buffer enabling each enumerator to retrieve all elements from the shared source sequence, without duplicating source enumeration side-effects.

member.name: M:System.Linq.EnumerableEx.Memoize``2(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Func{System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``1}})
member.summary: Memoizes the source sequence within a selector function where each enumerator can get access to all of the sequence's elements without causing multiple enumerations over the source.
member.param: Selector function with memoized access to the source sequence for each enumerator.
member.returns: Sequence resulting from applying the selector function to the memoized view over the source sequence.

member.name: M:System.Linq.EnumerableEx.Memoize``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a buffer with a view over the source sequence, causing a specified number of enumerators to obtain access to all of the sequence's elements without causing multiple enumerations over the source.
member.param: Number of enumerators that can access the underlying buffer. Once every enumerator has obtained an element from the buffer, the element is removed from the buffer.
member.returns: Buffer enabling a specified number of enumerators to retrieve all elements from the shared source sequence, without duplicating source enumeration side-effects.

member.name: M:System.Linq.EnumerableEx.Memoize``2(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Int32,System.Func{System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``1}})
member.summary: Memoizes the source sequence within a selector function where a specified number of enumerators can get access to all of the sequence's elements without causing multiple enumerations over the source.
member.param: Number of enumerators that can access the underlying buffer. Once every enumerator has obtained an element from the buffer, the element is removed from the buffer.
Selector function with memoized access to the source sequence for a specified number of enumerators.
member.returns: Sequence resulting from applying the selector function to the memoized view over the source sequence.
